creator: willy@debian.org
text:
Forwarding Debian bug http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=140565

According to the tcpdump presented at the above URL, IIS is sending a 304
response with a Content-Length: of 0.  This causes Apache to cache a
zero-sized object.  While IIS's behaviour does violate a MUST NOT, I
think Apache could handle this situation better.

It's nice to know that you won't fix this bug, but how about a quick comment as
to why you don't intend to fix it?  Is it fixed in 2.2, for example?
creator: willy@debian.org
